title: BSE Sensex flat in volatile trade, NSE Nifty below 8350; PNB, HDFC bank, Maruti Suzuki stocks surge
text:
Other Articles Punjab National Bank shares rise nearly 6 per cent on PNB Q1 Stocks that are likely to be in focus today: Maruti Suzuki, Tech Mahindra and more Market Outlook: BSE Sensex, NSE Nifty to remain in a somber mood; may see some recovery in latter trade BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty rocks between flat-positive-negative on Tuesday after losing nearly 2% during last session.
The BSE Sensex was trading 48.90 points down while the Nifty was down by 9.75 points at 2:45 pm IST.
However in afternoon trade, Sensex and Nifty fell over 90 points.
At 2.26 pm, Sensex was down 9.62 points at 27,551.76. Similarly, Nifty was up 4.70 points at 8,356.30 during the same time.
At 1.46 pm, Sensex was down 91.57 points at 27,469.81. Similarly, Nifty was up 22.35 points at8,338.65 during the same time.
At 12.10 pm, Sensex was up 8.45 points at 27,569.83. Similarly, Nifty was up 8.80 points at 8,369.80 during the same time.
At 11.26 am, Sensex was up 6.97 points at 27,568.35. Similarly, Nifty was up 5.25 points at 8,366.25 during the same time.
At 10.30 am, Sensex was up 106.45 points at 27,667.83. Similarly, Nifty was up 26.50 points at 8,387.50 during the same time.
Sensex rebounded over 100 points in early trade, but later turned volatile amid a mixed trend at other Asian markets.
Market was led by gains in ICICI Bank, Infosys , RIL, L&T and Bharti Airtel .
Punjab National Bank shares rose over 5 per cent.
Pulled down by higher bad loan provisioning, country’s second largest public sector lender Punjab National Bank (PNB)’s net profit during the June quarter nearly halved to Rs 721 crore.
PNB’s first quarter net profit of current fiscal on Monday showed a 48.68 per cent decline from Rs 1,405 crore reported the same quarter of 2014-15 fiscal.
At 9:42 am, BSE Sensex traded 9.97 points down at 27,551.41. NSE Nifty gained 2.95 points at 8,363.95.
At 9:32 am, BSE Sensex traded 53.00 points up at 27,614.38. NSE Nifty gained 22.45 points at 8,383.45
HDFC bank and BHEL have been the biggest gainers in the session so far as their shares went up by 1.6% and 1.25 respectively.
The session has been good for tech shares as the BSE Information and Technology index went up by 0.34%..Shares of Infosys and TCS went up by 0.73% and 0.56% respectively. US investment banking firm Jefferies said in a research note released last week that it expects IT industry revenue to pick up Quarter on Quarter due to seasonality and FX tailwinds however on Year on Year basis the results will show a slowdown.
Tata motors and Hero Motocorp were the biggest losers in the session so far as their shares fell by 2.6% and 2.3% respectively.
Foreign Portfolio Investors(FPIs) have been net buyers in the Indian markets for last three sessions. Although Sensex lost more than 500 points on the Monday FPIs bought cash equities worth $6.2 million taking the year to date inflows to $7.4 billion, as per Bloomberg data. “In the coming days Indian stock markets would be the most preferred destination for global investors as the overall scenario in the economy is positive. The falling crude oil prices in the global markets have brought down the fiscal deficit. The plans of current government to increase infrastructure spending will boost the market sentiment. However, one of the key concerns is monsoon. Poor monsoon will dampen rural demand,” said Anand Shanbhag, Head of Research at Tata Securities.
The Shanghai composite(China) which slumped more than 8.5% in the previous session continued to operate in the red as the index was down by 1%. As per a Bloomberg report, measure of volatility in the Chinese markets jumped to its highest since 1997 on Monday. The report also said fall in the Shanghai market raised questions about viability of government efforts to push up the share prices as economy slows down. However, the session has been good for other asian markets. Despite fall in Chinese markets, Hong Kong’s Hang Seng was up by 1.5%. Nikkei(Japan) and Kospi(South Korea) were also up by 0.2%,0.1% respectively.
